signalslinkep:usageinfo-signalslinkep-ti: SignalsLink.EP - Integration between the Signals and Electrical Progressive mods
signalslinkep:usageinfo-signalslinkep-te:
SignalsLink.EP
Extends the Signals mod with components that integrate with the Electrical Progressive mod.

Electrical Progressive
EP Switch
A switch controlled by a signal. Allows turning the transmission of electrical current on or off.
If a signal is present at the input, the switch is on. If no signal is present at the input, the switch is off.
EP Meter
Provides information about the state of the electrical network the meter is connected to.
If signal 1 is present at the input, the output signal shows the battery charge state in the network. 0 - batteries are empty, 15 - batteries are fully charged.
If signal 2 is present at the input, the output signal shows the production/consumption balance of electricity. Values 1-7: more is consumed than produced, 8: consumption=production, 9-15: production exceeds consumption.
If signal 3 is present at the input, the output signal shows the current in the cables at the block the meter is attached to. Values 0-12 represent current from 0 up to the cable's maximum capacity. 13-15 represent cable overload (likely already smoldering and will soon burn out)
If another signal is present at the input, the output is signal 0.
